item.title: Microsoft gives deepfake porn victims a tool to scrub images from Bing search
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
The advancement of generative AI tools has created a new problem for the internet: the proliferation of synthetic nude images resembling real people. On Thursday, Microsoft took a major step to give revenge porn victims a tool to stop its Bing search engine from returning these images. Microsoft announced a partnership with StopNCII, an organization […]

item.title: Driverless car-sharing startup Vay steers toward B2B services
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
The new business-to-business division is a bet on what co-founder and CEO Thomas von der Ohe thinks is the future of mobility.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drip Capital, a fintech that provides working capital to SMBs, picks up $113M
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Drip Capital has raised $113 million in a combination of $23 million in equity and $90 million in debt to provide credit to more small businesses in India and the U.S.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google’s AI-powered Ask Photos feature begins U.S. rollout
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Google said the feature could be used for more than just photo retrieval alone; users would also be able to ask questions to get helpful answers.

item.title: Endolith is using ‘Olympic caliber’ copper microbes to address the copper shortage
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The stealthily operating startup thinks it can narrow the gap by helping miners extract more copper from their mines.

item.title: All Hands AI raises $5M to build open source agents for developers
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
As with many open source startups, All Hands AI expects to monetize its service by offering paid, closed-source enterprise features.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: This robotic wheelchair can climb stairs
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Korea’s Institute for Machinery and Materials unveiled a pretty cool robotic wheelchair this week. By creating a compliant wheel that conforms to the terrain around it, these engineers have created an early version of a wheelchair that can climb stairs and traverse rocky terrain. The wheel uses a “smart chain” structure, which means that a […]

item.title: Mintlify is building a next-gen platform for writing software docs
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Mintlify offers a collection of documentation-authoring tools, including tools that can auto-generate docs from codebases.

item.title: German LLM maker Aleph Alpha pivots to AI support
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Europe doesn’t have many large language model (LLM) makers but one of these rare AI beasts — Germany’s Aleph Alpha — appears to be preparing to rule itself out of the running, per Bloomberg, which has an interview with CEO Jonas Andrulis on its pivot to a broader generative AI-support play. The idea with a […]

item.title: Rivian’s chief software designer is coming to TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Every automaker is aiming to build and sell the so-called software-defined vehicle. Rivian may have actually done it, but getting there wasn’t easy. Just ask Rivian’s chief of software Wassym Bensaid. In a bid to drive down manufacturing costs and improve the performance of its EVs, Rivian changed 600 parts on its flagship R1S SUV […]

item.title: The AI industry is obsessed with Chatbot Arena, but it might not be the best benchmark
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
LMSYS' Chatbot Arena is perhaps the most popular AI benchmark today — and an industry obsession. But it's far from a perfect measure.

item.title: Google expands AI-powered virtual try-on tool to include dresses
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Google announced Thursday that it expanded its generative AI-powered virtual try-on tool to support dresses, allowing users to virtually wear thousands of dresses from hundreds of brands, including Boden, Maje, Sandro, Simkhai and Staud. According to the company, dresses were one of the most searched apparel categories for the tool. However, as Google explained in […]

item.title: Announcing the Startup Battlefield 200 at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Michael Schick
item.description:
TechCrunch Disrupt 2024, which takes place from October 28-30 at Moscone West in San Francisco, is rapidly approaching. Today we’re thrilled to announce the 200 startups selected to participate in this year’s Startup Battlefield 200 (SB 200) cohort. TechCrunch’s editorial staff read, vetted and debated over thousands of applications. Narrowing the group down to 200 […]

item.title: Zamp targets growing demand for sales tax solutions
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Until six years ago, many e-commerce and SaaS businesses could have avoided paying sales tax to states where they had customers, but no physical presence. But as online shopping grew, states realized they were losing out on tax revenue. The era of free-riding for online retailers ended in 2018 when South Dakota took Wayfair to […]

item.title: YouTube to limit teens’ exposure to videos about fitness and weight across global markets
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
YouTube is going to limit teens’ exposure to videos that promote and idealize a certain fitness level or physical appearance, the company announced on Thursday. The safeguard first rolled out in the U.S. last year and is now being introduced to teens globally. The announcement comes as YouTube has faced criticism over the past few […]

item.title: YouTube is developing AI detection tools for music and faces, plus creator controls for AI training
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Also of note, YouTube is in the early stages of coming up with a solution to address the use of its content to train AI models.

item.title: US, UK and EU sign on to the Council of Europe’s high-level AI safety treaty
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
We’re not very close to any specifics on how, exactly, AI regulations will be implemented and ensured, but today a swathe of countries including the U.S., the U.K. and the European Union signed up to a treaty on AI safety laid out by the Council of Europe (COE), an international standards and human rights organization. item.title: French clean tech startup Calyxia nets $35M to tackle microplastics pollution

item.description:
With a fresh $35M in the bank, French cleantech startup Calyxia has profitability within sight. But it's just getting started.

item.title: ZipRecruiter’s new tool will quickly match and schedule an intro call with potential candidates
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Hiring platform ZipRecruiter is launching a new tool, called ZipIntro, to let employers schedule introductory calls with potential candidates at a set time. The tool will also help recruiters suggest potential candidates using AI. Employers can input information about the role and select a date and time for introductory calls. After that, ZipIntro matches them […]

item.title: Portex founder Brittany Ennix learned the importance of supply chains from Uber and Flexport
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Brittany Ennix launched Portex, a company that allows SMBs to connect with freight partners and manage shipments and operations in one place.
